remarks: A version of ~ evth2 using bound-variable hypotheses instead of distinct variable conditions.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
evth2f.1 $e |- F/_ x F $.
evth2f.2 $e |- F/_ y F $.
evth2f.3 $e |- F/_ x X $.
evth2f.4 $e |- F/_ y X $.
evth2f.5 $e |- X = U. J $.
evth2f.6 $e |- K = ( topGen ` ran (,) ) $.
evth2f.7 $e |- ( ph -> J e. Comp ) $.
evth2f.8 $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( J Cn K ) ) $.
evth2f.9 $e |- ( ph -> X =/= (/) ) $.
evth2f $p |- ( ph -> E. x e. X A. y e. X ( F ` x ) <_ ( F ` y ) ) $.
$d x y $.
